active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the impact of PCI SSF adoption on reducing cardholder data breaches. Use recent examples (e.g., merchant audits failing Req 6) and address misconceptions like 'SSF replaces PCI DSS' to critically analyze benefits and challenges.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in PCI DSS secure software requirements (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Secure Software Development Lifecycle > 001_Secure Software Concepts > 002_Security Standards/Compliance > PCI DSS secure software requirements). Use this completed research context: PCI DSS (v4.0) protects cardholder data; Req 6 mandates secure software dev (6.1: vuln processes; 6.2: secure processes w/threat modeling; 6.3: code analysis; 6.4: change mgmt; 6.5: secure coding vs CWE; 6.6: WAF equiv). SSF (2019): S3 (software security), Secure SLC (SDLC security integration). Sources: PCI SSC docs, sentinelone.com/pci-dss, rsisecurity.com/pci-ssf, securitycompass.com/software-security-framework. Incorporate: Learning objectives [paste array above], active learning [paste above], 4-layer scaffolding [paste above], flashcard schema [paste above]. Voter consensus: 100% approval on completeness (Req 6 details, misconceptions), pedagogy (Bloom's progression), concept map. Generate 50 flashcards strictly following the schema. Balance: 20% Layer1/REMEMBER-UNDERSTAND, 30% Layer2/APPLY, 30% Layer3/ANALYZE, 20% Layer4/EVALUATE-CREATE. 60% MCQ w/distractors, 25% Q&A, 15% cloze. Ensure university pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition friendly, measurable outcomes. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards.
